Command Line Interface¶

class sara.CommandLineInterface¶

A command-line based UI for grabbing user input.

Implements several functions for obtaining user input using Python’s built-in raw_input(). Meant to be a parent class. Does not have any attributes of its own.

defaultInput(prompt='', default_value='')¶

Replace empty user input from raw_input with a default value.

Prompts user for input with raw_input(). If the returned string is empty, default_value is returned.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str) – Prompt to pass to raw_input().
  • default_value (str, optional) – Value to return if user returns empty string. If default_value is not a string, it is converted to a string before being returned.
Returns:

User input from raw_input() or default_value.
Return type:

str
getBoolean(prompt)¶

Prompts user for a y/n response. Returns a bool.

Converts user input to lower case, then reads the first character of of input, returning True if it’s "y", and False if "n". If the first character of user input is neither "n" nor "y", getBoolean() will try again until the user’s response is valid.

Parameters:prompt (str) – Prompt to pass to raw_input().
Returns:True for "yes"-type responses, False for "no"-types.
getFilePath(prompt=None)¶

Prompt the user for path to an existing file.

Uses raw_input() to prompt for a file path, which can either be an absolute or relative path. User’s response must be a path to an existing file and must not be a directory. If response is invalid, getFilePath() will try again until the user’s response is valid.

Parameters:prompt (str, optional) – Prompt to pass to raw_input(). If omitted, the user is prompted with "Please input the full path to the file: ".
Returns:A string containing a valid path to an existing file.
getFileWithExtension(prompt=None, extension={})¶

Prompts user for a file path, possibly checking for an extension.

Uses getFilePath() to prompt user for an existing filename that ends with one of the extensions in extension. extension is a dict with the format {typeName : acceptedExtensions}.

Examples

Checking for a PNG file:

ui = CommandLineInterface()
prompt = "File path to your PNG image: "
extension = {"PNG" : '.png'}
file_path = ui.getFileWithExtension(prompt, extension)

Checking for a TIFF file:

ui = CommandLineInterface()
prompt = "File path to your TIFF image: "
extension = {"TIFF" : ['.tif', '.tiff']}
file_path = ui.getFileWithExtension(prompt, extension)

If the user does not enter a valid file path, getFileWithExtension() prompts the user again using the typeName from extension.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str, optional) – Prompt to pass to raw_input().
  • extension (dict, optional) – File extension to require.
Returns:

A string containing a valid path to an existing file with the extension from extension.
getFloat(prompt=None, default=None)¶

Prompt user for a float.

Uses defaultInput() to prompt for a decimal number. If casting the user’s response would result in a ValueError, the user is re-prompted until a valid response is given.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str, optional) – Prompt to pass to raw_input(). If omitted, the user is prompted with "Please enter a decimal number (e.g. 1.51): "
  • default (optional) – Value to return if user response is an empty string.
Returns:

Either a float or the value of default.
getInteger(prompt=None, default=None)¶

Prompt user for an integer.

Uses defaultInput() to prompt for an integer. If casting the user’s response would result in a ValueError, the user is re-prompted until a valid response is given.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str, default) – Prompt to pass to raw_input(). If omitted, the user is prompted with "Please enter an integer: ".
  • default (optional) – Value to return if user response is an empty string.
Returns:

Either an int or the value of default.
getNatural(prompt=None, default=None)¶

Prompts user for a non-negative integer.

Uses defaultInput() to prompt for an integer. If user response is invalid, the user is re-prompted until a valid response is given.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str, optional) – Prompt to pass to raw_input(). If omitted, the user is prompted with "Please enter a non-negative integer: ".
  • default (optional) – Value to return if user response is an empty string.
Returns:

Either an int or the value of default.
getPercent(prompt=None, default=None)¶

Prompt user for a percentage.

Uses defaultInput() to prompt for a float. Any %-signs appearing in user input are removed. User is expected to enter a percentage, but the response is divided by 100. See below.

Example

Entering 90 versus 90%:

>>> ui = CommandLineInterface()
>>> p1 = ui.getPercent()
Please enter a percentage (e.g. 90.5%): 90
>>> p1
0.9
>>> p2 = ui.getPercent()
Please enter a percentage (e.g. 90.5%): 90%
>>> p2
0.9

Response must be an integer between 0 and 100 (inclusive). As with the other methods, getPercent() will re-prompt if response is invalid.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str, optional) – Prompt to pass to raw_input(). If omitted, the user is prompted with "Please enter a percentage (e.g. 90.5%): ".
  • default (optional) – Value to return if user response is empty string.
Returns:

Either a float or the value of default.
reserveDirectory(prompt=None, extension='')¶

Prompt user for a path to create or overwrite a directory.

Uses raw_input() to prompt for a directory path, which can be an absolute or relative path. User’s response must be either a path that does not point to any files or directories, or must point to an existing directory. If the directory already exists, the user is prompted for whether to overwrite the directory.

The user can specify a directory extension. If the user’s response does not end with the given extension, extension is automatically appended.

Example

Prompting for directory with extension:

>>> ui = CommandLineInterface()
>>> dirname = ui.reserveDirectory(extension='.sima')
Please input a directory name: new_dir
>>> dirname
'new_dir.sima'
Parameters:
  • prompt (str, optional) – Prompt to pass to raw_input(). If omitted, the user is prompted with "Please input a directory name: ".
  • extension (str, optional) – Directory extension to add if not already included in user’s response.
Returns:

A string containing a path not pointing to any file (including any directories), or pointing to an existing directory.
reserveFilePath(prompt=None, allow_overwrite=False)¶

Prompt user for a path to create or overwrite a file.

Uses raw_input() to prompt for a file path, which can either be an absolute or relative path. User’s response must either be a path that does not point to any files, or a path to an existing file (not a directory). If the path is to an existing file and allow_overwrite is False, the user will be prompted for whether to overwrite the file. Otherwise the path will be returned without any complaint.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str, optional) – Prompt ot pass to raw_input(). If omitted, the user is prompted with "Please input file name: ".
  • allow_overwrite (bool, optional) – Whether to prompt user if path points to exising file.
Returns:

A string containing a path not pointing to a directory.
